Question 4. Identify the sentence with t: The dog, which is brown, chased its tail.
The book that is on the table is mine.
The girl, who is wearing a blue dress, is my sister.
The car that is parked outside belongs to John.
The tree, which is in the backyard, is tall.
Question 6. Identify the sentence that c: She had arrived home before I did.
They had finished their dinner when we arrived.
He had left for work before we woke up.
We had gone to the beach the day before.
The movie had started at 7 p.m.
Question 8. Identify the sentence that a: The broken glass needs to be cleaned up.
She had gone to the store.
They have been running in the park.
I have been studying all day.
Question 10. Identify the sentence that: This book is better than that one.
She is the most beautiful girl in the class.
He is taller than I am.
The dog ran faster than its friend.
It is the worst movie I've ever seen.
